question: For the Defective Computers in a Lab problem, find the conditional probability that the chosen computer is defective given that it is from manfacturer $A$, $P(E_D|E_A)$.

answers.feedback: Correct! You should have calculated this using the ratio of $P(E_D \cap E_A)= 1/5$ and $P(E_A) = 2/5.$
Note that $P(E_D|E_A) \ne P(E_A|E_D)$. Use the definition of conditional probability to calculate  $P(E_D|E_A) = P(E_D \cap E_A)/ P(E_A)$.
Incorrect. Use the definition of conditional probability to calculate $P(E_D|E_A) = P(E_D \cap E_A)/ P(E_A)$.
Incorrect. Probabilities cannot be more than 1.
Incorrect. Probabilities cannot be less than 0.

question: For the Defective Computers in a Lab problem, find the conditional probability that the chosen computer is defective given that it is from manfacturer $B$, $P(E_D|E_B)$.

answers.feedback: Correct! You should have calculated this using the ratio of $P(E_D \cap E_B)= 2/5$ and $P(E_B) = 3/5.$
Incorrect. Note that $P(E_D|E_B) \ne P\left(E_D\left| \overline{E_B} \right. \right)$. Use the definition of conditional probability to calculate $P(E_D|E_B) = P(E_D \cap E_B)/ P(E_B)$.
Incorrect. Use the definition of conditional probability to calculate $P(E_D|E_B) = P(E_D \cap E_B)/ P(E_B)$.
Incorrect. Probabilities cannot be more than 1.
Incorrect. Probabilities cannot be less than 0.
